# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym`. The values in this new column are obtained by applying the anonymous function to each element of the `dt` column. This function extracts year and month from the DateTime object, multiplies them together (since year is an integer between 1 and 9999 and month is an integer between 1 and 12) and adds them together.

The `map` function applies this anonymous function to each element of the `dt` column. The result is a new DataFrame with the additional `:ym` column.
